column2: There is no evidence of adverse maternal or fetal effects from vaccinating pregnant women.

column1: American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists
column2: Pregnant individuals should have access to COVID-19 vaccines
Pregnant Women may receive the vaccine if the benefit of vaccinating outweighs the potential vaccine risks.‚Äù

column1: Royal College of Obstetricians and Gynaecologists
column2: While there is no known risk associated with giving other non-live vaccines to pregnant women, research on the matter is still ongoing. The benefits and risks should be discussed on an individual basis.
